text:
A compilation of polls for the next U.K general election.












 Back to top

A look at the polls from the 2020 presidential election between Donald Trump and Joe Biden by their ratings from 538.com. The A’s polls had Biden at or above 50% through the eleven month and they underestimated Trump 80% of the time having him below 45%.









The B and B/C polls were the worst for Trump as they put him below 45% to 40% and had Biden reach the 50% after the summer.









The C and C/D polls were surprisingly better as they didn’t diverge too much, they had Trump hoovering above 45% and Biden above 50% but there not many polls conducted.









The polls without ratings didn’t do too well the few of them as they had Trump below 40%.









All the polls were download from 538.com, separated by their ratings and calculated on a 2-day moving average using the rstudio zoo library.



 Back to top

title: Welcome
text:
Welcome to my website where I have different projectx!



 Back to top

From 1990 to 2000, the eastern part of the state gained while the central to the west lost population. The City of Boston gained the by adding over 14,000 people while the town of Harvard(not the school) lost more than 6,000 people.











For the second decade in a row, the City of Boston gained population, it gained almost 28,000 people and the town of Braintree lost the most with about 3,000 people leaving. Overall, the eastern part of the state fared well with lower population increase and the central to west didn’t lose too many people.













 Back to top

A look at presidential elections performance from 2012 to 2020 in this majority Latino city of Lawrence in the state of Massachusetts.






.The city is also the poorest in the state located in the north east bordering Salem, New Hampshire. Obama’12 received 83% of the vote, Clinton ’16 received 81% with 1,000 more votes and Biden’20 did very poorly getting only 73% from Trump improvement with Latino voters.




 Back to top

A look at the presidential election results of the city of Philadelphia which is important for statewide victory for democrats. Philadelphia is also a majority black city, they live in the dark blue areas as they are a strong voting block for the democrats.





Obama`08 dominated the city of Philadelphia against McCain, he even did very well in the white working class area in the north of the city.

Obama`12 also did well even though he lost about 1,000 votes mainly due to low turnout in the black neighborhood. He maintained his support in the north but the story was Romney doing worse than McCain did 2008.





The change from 2008 and 2012 for Obama. 2012 had turnout drop from 2008, green areas is where he did better in ’12 and blue areas are where he did worse from ’08.





Map showing how McCain’08 and Romney’12 performed. McCain did well in the white areas while Romney did well in the black and Latino areas of the city.





Turnout in 2012 increased from 2008 mainly in white areas while it decreased in mainly black areas.



 Back to top
